headline: Homemade Breakfast Sausage
description: Homemade breakfast sausage patties made with ground pork, brown sugar, and sage deliver sweet and savory flavor in every bite. Serve alongside eggs or in a breakfast sandwich!

video.name: How to Make Homemade Breakfast Sausage

name: Homemade Breakfast Sausage

recipeInstructions.text: Mix together brown sugar, sage, salt, black pepper, marjoram, red pepper flakes, and cloves in a small bowl until well combined.
Place pork in a large bowl. Add spice mixture and mix with your hands until well combined. Form mixture into 6 patties.

Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add patties and saute until browned and crispy, about 5 minutes per side. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 160 degrees F (71 degrees C).

review.reviewBody: I added a bit more sage and a few extra pepper flakes. It was a tiny bit bland the other way. Great taste, reminiscent of the popular breakfast sausages but with less sodium and without all the ridiculous additives
Followed it exactly. Recipe omits any mention of fat or oil for sautéing. Came out dry and tasted like meatloaf. A waste.
I halved the ingredients and still had 7 patties with one lb of freshly ground pork butt. I think they are delicious!
This recipe worked really well with ground turkey instead of pork. It’s definitely one I will use again!
The clove just isn’t right. Doesn’t even taste like sausage with it added.

Quick and easy recipe. I don't like sausage but this was really good! I used oregano instead of marjoram since I didn't have it. Other than that I kept everything the same. I am looking forward to eating the rest of my patties.

This was good and easy. I only had one pound of ground pork, but I did NOT halve the spices. It seemed a bit dry, but I'm thinking store-bought breakfast sausage has extra fat added in. Good taste and probably "healthier" than store-bought. I would make again.
Made for the first time as written. Big hit. Will increase red pepper flakes next time.
I cut salt to half and substitute half of meat with finely chopped mushroom and cauliflower. It came out really good.
It’s a very good recipe. I doubled the amount of seasonings except the salt. And I would add just a little bit more red pepper flake.
I made this recipe with freshly ground boneless country-style sparerib pork. It turned out perfect!

Had a hankering to make some sausage/egg muffins for breakfast, but where I'm at the grocery stores don't have breakfast sausage so decided to make my own. I doubled up on most of the spices, except salt/pepper, as suggested by some of the comments. It came out great.

I liked the basic ingredients, but also added real maple syrup instead of the brown sugar, and some minced garlic and a little liquid smoke. I think I added to much salt as I was making a venison/pork sausage along with grinding my own pork and venison. It still tasted pretty good, but I will scale back on the salt and liquid smoke. I want to be able to taste the maple and garlic so I may delete the liquid smoke all together.
Made them this morning for my family! They're pretty good! I used hamburger instead of pork as that was all I had, but it still taste great! Will make again!!
Great flavor. Made with ground pork or turkey - both were tasty.

I was so pleased with this recipe. I used organic ground pork we bought at a local farm, plus my organic spices as per the recipe. I added 2 Tablespoons of brown sugar and it tempered the spices just enough to not overpower the dish. I warmed the patties up the next morning and crumbled it in my scrambled eggs. It’s a good, yet easy dish.

Very good and easy to prepare. Can be done ahead of time and just freeze or chill the mixture and thaw whenever you need it. 
My variation is just cutting the marjoram and nutmeg half the amount of the original recipe.

I doubled the spices, sugar and salt as someone above had suggested. I would probably leave out the salt completely, reduce the amount of brown sugar by half (from my doubled quantity. But recipe is a great place to start. I think I would make the recipe ahead next time to give the spices a chance to fully mix.
It's a great recipe, love it. No need to change anything.

Tastes exactly like the ones you buy at the store!! My family loves them! They're easy to make, and you can make a whole batch and freeze them, then reheat in the micro-wave! Totally worth making them!

We used this to make 35# of sausage after processing a feral hog. It took some calculating to figure 108 servings but it turned out amazing! We combined the pork with ~25% mutton that we had in the freezer and it was honestly some of the best sausage I've ever had. We omitted the red pepper flakes from the main recipe, for the sake of the kids, but I add it back to my own portions before I cook it. This is our new go-to recipe!

We had always used Morton's Sausage and Meatloaf seasoning. Since they discontinued it, I have been looking for a replacement, and finally found it! I didn't have marjoram, or cloves, but it was the closest I've found! Great recipe!

Excellent recipe. We adjusted the measurements to make 15 pound batch of venison sausage. We were pleased with the results. It was very good. My Dad owned his own meat market and had his special recipe for the sausage he sold. We could never find where he wrote it down when he passed. This recipe was a close second to his recipe. I definitely recommend it!!
Delicious! Made these for breakfast along with homemade biscuits and eggs....will definitely make again!! Great recipe
This was a great flavor. I cooked 1 small pattie to taste and thought my pinch of clove may have been slightly too heavy. Doubled the sage in the rest and this was a great balance.

I think this is a very good starter recipe which can be easily adapted to your personal taste.
As with other reviews I believe there is too much salt in this recipe. For my own personal taste I would add more sage for a breakfast sausage. I used cayenne pepper instead of red pepper flakes. I cut the meat down to fit my meat grinder. I added more fat because my loin was very lean. Good sausage needs a certain amount of fat. I then added the spices and mixed well.bi have heard that the spices are more evenly distributed when added before grinding. I also added a half cup of water because the last time I made sausage it was tough. This sausage has a very good texture and flavor. There is just a hint of heat from the cayenne pepper. Which is fine for me. I like a taste of pepper but I don't wish to be burned. If you like spicy sausage you will need to increase both the black pepper (unless you are using fresh ground) and cayenne. I made a 5lb batch. I also added a small amount of blackened seasoning.

After many recipes that failed to get the seasoning I wanted, this is the one to use. This is like any store bought or what you’d get at a restaurant. It’s the sausage I grew up eating. Easy to make and great for breakfast.
Didn’t expect this to be so good. I was tempted to change up the spices but d
Wow, I may never buy store made breakfast sausage again! Delicious. I’ve never left a review here but had to compliment this one!
Fantastic. I used it for leftover ground pork. It cane out great. Good recipe.
Absolutely love this recipe!!!

Excellent basic recipe. I like sage and the stuff is fluffy anyway so I doubled it. I'd go further on the red pepper flakes to taste. And I used brownulated brown sugar. Mix spices and salt thoroughly and distribute evenly over meat before mixing it in. Try cooking a small patty and tasting to adjust seasonings.
Never buying store packaged sausage again!

It taste the same has the breakfast sausages we buy, very tasty. Made it with 2 pounds of pork shoulder & a pound of smoke ham. Next time I will try just with pork shoulder to see what the difference is. I give it a 5 star rating.
Excellent. I will reduce salt amount the next time I make sausage. great recioe

Great recipe! The seasonings were spot on.
I used the paddle attachment on my Kitchen Aid to blend all the ingredients together. I then made patties with my burger press, pre-cooked them, then froze to make quick and easy breakfasts and breakfast sandwiches.
Thanks for sharing.
Fantastic, substituted 1 lb extra lean ground turkey for 2 lbs pork. Extra lean turkey needs the recipe doubled to make it taste anything like sausage...

My family wanted breakfast bowls but we didn’t have any breakfast sausage or ground meet but we did have tofu. I used this recipe to season the tofu and it was SO delicious. Even my husband who usually balks at vegetarian meals gave this one 5 stars.

This was my first time ever making fresh homemade sausage. The recipe was easy and budget-friendly. I added Mrs. Dash pepper flakes for added flavor instead of plain pepper flakes. It turns out delicious. I will make this again. Thanks for sharing.
It was delicious! I added 1/4 tsp. of Onion powder, and 1/8 tsp. Garlic powder.

I made this as is, but adjusted for 9lbs of pork. This is the best sausage I’ve ever had. Not just breakfast sausage, all sausage. I’m a huge sausage lover and have made my own sausage for years. This is just awesome.
Nice subtle flavors and easy to make. I'll be making more of this.

we love sausage with the sage flavor and this gives a very good sage sausage taste. I have to leave out a little bit of the red pepper as we don’t like things too spicy but I will be using this is as my go to when I have a regular country or mild sausage that I want to kick up to a sage sausage! very yummy

I made these changes as to what I had on hand . I added 3tsp total sage. 1 tsp majorum. 1tsp Italian seasoning. I did not add sugar. I added 1 tsp fennel. No clove. I store 2 to a package and freeze for breakfast sandwiches.
We love this recipe but I only use 1 pound of pork for the amount of spices listed. I made it once with 2 pounds and we all agreed it was not flavorful enough.
I used ground chicken & it was great!
Best sausage ever. I did add a little bit to much pepper but other than that it was awesome. Next batch will be even better ????
I made it as written so that my review was based on the original. It makes a great sausage, however it was a bit too salty for my liking. I will definitely make it again with less salt.

Excellent breakfast sausage! I use butcher’s blend ground meat which is 1/2 pork and 1/2 beef. I just like the flavor better. I added 1/2 cup maple syrup because I love the flavor and it helps browning. Brown your patties and freeze for a quicker breakfast

I used left over ground turkey from a batch of chili I'm cooking. Used maybe 1/3 pound and didn't measure anything. Also added poultry season. I added the meat, water and seasoning and let it cook down. Taste really good. Then used the left over liquid and added cabbage and red onion. So good. i guess this is an early St. Patrick's day brunch. Blessings...
Great recipe! I used beef instead of pork and my family loved it. This one is definitely a winner.

I've made this several times now and it's pretty good. There's a couple things though... First, to improve the flavor add 1 or 2 tablespoons of apple cider vinegar. It helps bring everything together. I also like to let everything cure in the fridge at least over night before cooking. But, the real issue is actually the type of pork you're using. Typically ground pork from the grocery store doesn't have enough fat in it for sausage. The stuff I get is, surprisingly, marked at 85/15 and my research shows an 80/20 mix is better for sausage. I may just break out the meat grinder and pick up a shoulder roast to see if I can get a better texture AND taste.

I too can no longer buy commercial sausage, so this is my go-to now. I have to limit my sodium, so I omit the salt and substitute a dash of vinegar and some extra pepper. Also, if you have a stuffer, you can get some lamb casings and make link sausage.
these taste identical to the spiced breakfast patties I used to get eons ago in the boxes!! they're freaking amazing!!
Very great taste I will be making it again I will add a little more pepper and sage for mine but my moms will be how it’s called for
just what I needed to spice up my ground pork for my homemade biscuits and gravy. I won't by packaged sausage again. Thank you for the recipe!

Have made this several times now. First time, by recipe, turned out okay but not quite my taste desire for sausage. Since then I am happier with it by doubling the sage, leaving out the brown sugar, and added a tablespoon of canola oil to make it hold patty shape and cook more evenly. Good point to start to make your sausage at home and avoid the preservatives in grocery offerings.

I love this recipe! I made mine into little meatballs and added them to soup with a chicken stock base & other veggies and frick it was good. Sausage soup...yum! Anyways, I've used this mix a lot now. it's very versatile. p.s. I've only tried it with ground turkey, not pork.
Tasty simple and perfect to add to a nice gravy.
To die for. We made with fresh ground pork that we ground ourselves. Freezes great.
I added a pinch of ground red pepper, it was yummy
Wonderful flavor and lean made from loin. I have to use a tablespoon of lard to fry. I sprinkle additional sage to get that southern homemade country flavor. I also double grind for good texture.

If the recipe doubled all of its spices I would give this 5 stars but as is it is lacking flavor. I have never had cloves in a breakfast sausage before but it really added to the flavor . We ended up doubling all of the spices and made 30lbs. of sausage..Delicious!

I had pork roasts in my freezer from when we butchered a hog. I ground up 8 pounds of pork, hoping I would like the recipe. It is delicious! I added a little extra of each spice, just because we like things spicy, but it was good!!
I made this into patties and it is awesome!! Definitely won't be buying premade or prepacked stuff anymore!

I made this last night with a pound of turkey as I’m on WW and wanted a healthier option. I grounded it up and put it into my breakfast hash. My husband said he couldn’t even tell the difference between the breakfast sausage I buy and this one! He thought mine was better! I added a little syrup after it was cooked before mixing it into my hash. Super delicious! I will definitely use again!
This "Breakfast Sausage" was perfect! Thank you Lee Fogle for sharing your recipe.

Made this a couple times and it always comes out great. Read a couple reviews where people did a half pork/half turkey blend so we might try that in the future just to see. That's one of the things that makes this recipe great - it's easy to customize to your individual taste.

Excellent recipe. Definitely taste like a fresher version of the store bought patties. I didn't expect it to be so good from a few ingredients, and I don't think it needs more ingredients. Additions such as fennel or other Italian herbs, IMO, would ruin this. Sometimes simple is all it takes, otherwise you'd be making Italian sausage (which some people are actually using this recipe as a base for)

Some slight differences I made. I mixed 50/50 ground pork and ground turkey, which I don't think compromised the flavor at all. I questioned the use of red pepper flakes as that wouldn't disperse well in 2 pounds of meat, so I converted it to 1/8 tsp ground cayenne. I converted a "pinch" of ground cloves to 1/8 tsp because, seriously, a "pinch" is different to everyone. That's enough for them to serve their intended purpose as very subtle flavors.

Could it be better? I think being more generous with the measurements (instead of being exact like I did) or slightly decreasing the amount of meat by 1/4 pound would boost the flavor more, but the recipe as it stands is fantastic.

I followed the advice of others that said to double the spices and it was perfect. I also wanted to double the recipe - we took these camping -for easy breakfast as I precooked them. Then froze them! I only had ground chicken so I Used that with the ground pork. I felt that lightened them up a little and I’ll do that next time...there will def be a next time. My family and friends loved them. I also baked them. Perfect.

I live in Chile now so I cant buy this type of sausage at the supermarket. I just finished the recipe and they are perfect. Now I can make a Sausage McMuffin for breakfast (They font have them here). I got 12 patties and they when into the freezer. I hope I can make them last... jajajaja

I loved the list of spices. I doubled the brown sugar and I didn't have crushed red pepper so I used 1/2 tsp of cayanne. I also slightly increased the amount of sage. I tried the wax paper trick that someone mentioned but it didn't work for me; everything stuck to the wax paper. Maybe I need to find better wax paper... There is no doubt that this recipe needs to include a "rest period", as all the flavors seem to show themselves after about 24 hours. 
I sooo live this recipe, especially since I live in Chile and breakfast sausage is 100% unheard of and unavailable. This is my second go and I will keep making it every time I run out.

I made half the amount I only had 1 pound of pork so I half the seasoning and to make sure it wouldn't need more seasoning I cooked a little to taste and it was glorious even got a second opinion! Now its sitting in my refrigerator til breakfast!
I followed the recipe exactly. The flavor is really nice. Thanks to the contributor.
Simple recipe. I followed some suggestions like using one pound of pork, one pound of turkey, and two teaspoons of fennel. Tasted great.

Fantastic 
Use a little less salt though
I raised a pig and had fresh ground pork
No fillers
No additives
No chemicals
Mild but very tasty.
I added several shakes of Worscestershire Sauce to add some flavor. Then we made 6 patties and used them to make Breakfast Sausage, Eggs, Cheese, and Bacon in an English Muffin. Very tasty!
It was delicious, my family enjoyed it. I didn't really follow the amount of spices listed, just go with what I think was good, and also add some garlic powder. Amazing....

I made a couple very very small changes that for me anyways made this recipe way way tastier! I swap the black pepper out for white pepper, and add 1 tsp of fennel seed per 2lbs of pork. The fennel was a huge upgrade in taste!
excellent! Made it for a men's breakfast at our church and go allthumbs up.
***SALT ALERT...1/2 Tsp was more than enough I put 1/4 tsp of crushed red pepper flakes in too..other than that was delicious and would have again!
First time following this recipe. It was very bland, I would agree to double the spice:-). I will try again:-). as it has much potential:-)
So nice to be able to make my own breakfast sausage. I made this recipe with 1/2 pork and 1/2 chicken thighs. My wife really likes the patties, nothing weird in them like store bought sausage.

Had a hard time finding all the spices (live in Japan). Clove though is really important to the taste, but don't go over-board, can it can over flavor the sausage. Its really important to thoroughly crush the spices too. I did not form into patties, Instead, I cooked it as crumbled and once cooked, moved on into making it Gravy for Biscuits and Gravy.
Thank You Lee Fogel .
All though I did not have the ground cloves I added 1/2teaspoon of ground ginger.To be honest I think it's the best sausage that I have ever made.Will definitely make again.

My family is doing the Whole30 diet, so I left out the sugar, but added about 2tsp smoked paprika. I had never made it with the sugar, so I didn't know the difference and it was wonderful. I also increased the sage measurement to 1Tbsp. I believe I added a tad more of the marjoram, as well. Also, I didn't have ground pork, so I used ground beef. This was really yummy and will definitely make this again! I will try this with ground pork, and another batch with ground turkey, but the ground beef was delicious.

Delicious! Thank bused a pound and a half which made the seasonings more prominent
.
Good strong flavor. I cooked scrambled eggs after pouring of some of the grease out of the pan. You just have to let the pan cool down a little bit first so they don't burn.
I substituted fennel seed for the cloves. Amazing sausage recipe
I'll never buy Jimmy Dean sausage again. The ground pork we get is lean, making this a leaner sausage. The flavor is excellent, and it is easy to make. Thanks for sharing this recipe.
Super simple and absolutely delicious! So much better than pre-made sausage with all the additives and sugar! My family LOVED it and asked me to make it our new go to breakfast sausage!

My daughter has been craving breakfast sausage for about a week. Going through my deep freeze today I came across 5 packages of ground pork that just were not getting used. This seasoning recipe, is Hands down, the best breakfast sausage I’ve ever eaten! And sooo easy to make! The only change I made was substituting Oregano for the Marjoram as I did not have any marjoram. I will be making this recipe from now on instead of buying pre-seasoned breakfast sausage. Thanks for an outstanding recipe!!
Made it and messed it up, open the wrong end of the clove and it came pouring out, what I could save it was ok. Will be making it again soon. Will update later.

I am going to give this 4 stars because you must modify it. I made it exactly per the recipe and it was very bland. I took other reviewer's advice and doubled the spices (except for salt) and added some crushed red pepper flakes and fennel. It is perfect! My boyfriend asks me to make it all the time and says it tastes better than Jimmy Dean.
I made them I added pancake syrup and mustard fennel so good.

Awesome! I chose to do 1/2 ground turkey and it turned out amazing. It did have a kick so tread lightly on red pepper flakes if you don't like too spicy (like my family). I may do a spicy batch separately. Froze some bulk and did pattys. Highly recommend!
Tasted great did it as written. Served it at Xmas Breakfast and was well liked.
